intro: Spergularia hohuanshanensis, commonly known as the Hohuanshan sandspurry, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the family Caryophyllaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and succulent leaves. The plant is adapted to arid environments, with thick, fleshy stems that store water. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Spergularia hohuanshanensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
